html.Tip: HTML (HyperText Markup Language) and CSS (Cascading StyleSheets) make up a huge chunk of the internet as we know it!
You can use CSS on it's own to style your pages, or you can use a library or framework to enhance your look!  Some popular ones include Bootstrap, Material UI, Tailwind or SASS.
UI = User Interface, UX = User Experience
On a CSS sheet, an ID tag is noted by a '#', while a CLASS is noted by a '.' before the indicator.
When adding JavaScript 'Script' tags to your HTML page, it's usually best practice to place them at the bottom of your document, above the closing 'body' tag!
